title: Dead Weight [REQUESTED 2 Disc Edition, DVDRs, 2012 great indie z
description:
An excellent low-budget full-length zombie movie. This is how it's done. Winner of several awards. If you're a fan of dystopian, bleak zombie flicks, check it out.

Not much blood and gore, and actually, few zombies. So if that's all you care about, pass this up. There's plenty of that out there (I've uploaded a few). 

Compressed with DVDShrink to fit on single layer DVDs. First disc (with feature film on it) originally about 5.5gb so not too much compression was needed to get it to 4.6gb. Second disc (with only special features on it) was about 7.5gb so more compression was needed. 

Plot: 
Charlie Russell passes through the wilderness in the wake of an apocalyptic viral outbreak to reunite with his girlfriend, Samantha. As Charlie's journey brings him closer to his destination of Wausau, WI, he must face physical exhaustion, malicious survivors, and perhaps most menacing, his own emotional burdens. With his newfound traveling companions Charlie must attempt to break his obsessions with the past. He must learn to let it go.

Disc 1: 
feature film Dead Weight (89 minutes)
actor and director commentaries
outtakes
photo gallery
full trailer, teaser trailer
English, Spanish and French subtitles


Disc 2: 
685 Miles to Wausau: The Making of Dead Weight (105 minutes)
extended scenes
"Why'd You Jump Out of the God Damn Bushes?!" featurette
Channel 19 News (fake news segment)
